newsitem.title: USA: Urban Shopping pricing set for credit line.
newsitem.headline: Urban Shopping pricing set for credit line.

text.p: Urban Shopping Centers Inc said the pricing on its $90 million secured revolving line of credit was reduced from 142 basis points over LIBOR to 85 basis points over LIBOR.
The maturity date on the facility was extended from July 31, 1998 to April 30, 2000.
The facility is co-agented by Union Bank of Switzerland and Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York. Bank of Montreal, First Chicago, Hypo Bank and PNC Bank are participants in the facility.

"We are quite pleased with the new pricing on our revolving line of credit," Matthew Dominski, president, said in a statement. "The reduction in pricing reflects the progress made by Urban and the confidence of the lending community in our assets and strategy."
Separately, $80 million in financing was arranged for the company's Wolfchase Galleria in Memphis. The loan replaces a construction loan facility maturing on June 30, 2007.

The company also said it completed its acquisition of a 50 percent preferred interest in San Francisco Centre, a shoppingmall in downtown San Francisco. A private investor group owns the remaining interest in the property.
